skill.name: mixpanel-analytics
skill.description: MixPanel analytics tracking implementation and review Skill for Django4Lyfe optimo_analytics module. Implements new events following established patterns and reviews implementations for PII protection, schema design, and code quality.
skill.summary: MixPanel analytics tracking implementation and review Skill for Django4Lyfe optimo_analytics module....
skill.author: DiversioTeam

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with documentation only. No executable code present. Standard development tools requested for code review and implementation tasks. Low risk profile.

content.user_title: Implement and review MixPanel tracking events
content.value_statement: Adding MixPanel analytics to your Django app can lead to inconsistent event naming, PII leaks, and maintenance nightmares. This skill provides a structured 7-step process for implementing events with built-in PII protection and code quality checks.
actual_capabilities: Implement new MixPanel events following a 7-step checklist
Review existing analytics for PII violations
Create event constants, schemas, and registry entries
Generate service helper methods with fire-and-forget pattern
Validate test coverage and code patterns
limitations: Designed specifically for Django optimo_analytics module
Requires MixPanel integration already configured in your project
Does not install or configure MixPanel SDK itself
Only reviews patterns, cannot modify files without explicit prompts

use_cases.title: Add new tracking events
use_cases.description: Quickly add MixPanel tracking for new features with consistent patterns and PII protection built-in

use_cases.title: Audit analytics implementations
use_cases.description: Review staged or branch changes to ensure no PII leaks and all events follow naming conventions

use_cases.title: Enforce analytics standards
use_cases.description: Maintain consistent event schemas and tracking patterns across a growing analytics codebase

prompt_templates.title: Implement new event
prompt_templates.scenario: Add tracking for a new feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Use /mixpanel-analytics:implement to add tracking for user profile completion. Follow the 7-step checklist and ensure PII protection.

prompt_templates.title: Review staged changes
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /mixpanel-analytics:review staged to check my staged MixPanel changes for PII violations and pattern compliance.

prompt_templates.title: Audit feature branch
prompt_templates.prompt: Use /mixpanel-analytics:review branch to audit all analytics changes on this feature branch and generate a review report.

prompt_templates.title: Review entire module
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the entire optimo_analytics module with /mixpanel-analytics:review all. Check PII protection, schema design, service patterns, and test coverage.

output_examples.input: Use /mixpanel-analytics:implement to add tracking for when a user completes their profile setup
output: âœ“ Event constant added to constants.py
âœ“ Schema created in schemas.py with PII protection
âœ“ Service helper methods generated with fire-and-forget pattern
âœ“ Tests added for schema, registry, and tracking
âš  Review post-validation steps before merging

best_practices: Always use keyword-only arguments in tracking methods to prevent parameter ordering bugs
Wrap all tracking calls in try-except to ensure analytics never break business logic
Never send names, emails, or phone numbers to MixPanel - use UUIDs as identifiers
anti_patterns: Including 'cron' in event names - use is_cron_job property instead
Overriding base schema fields as Optional - pass empty string for missing values
Passing raw organization_id as distinct_id - always use org_<uuid> prefix

faq.question: Does this skill install MixPanel?
faq.answer: No. This skill guides implementation patterns assuming MixPanel SDK is already installed and configured in your Django project.

faq.question: What naming convention should I use for events?
faq.answer: Use format: {prefix}.{object}.{action}[.error]. Example: svc.surveys.survey_delivered or svc.hris_csv.upload.analysis_completed.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my code automatically?
faq.answer: The skill provides detailed guidance and code templates. You must explicitly invoke Edit or Write tools to apply changes to your codebase.

faq.question: How does this protect against PII leaks?
faq.answer: The skill enforces rules: no names, emails, or phone numbers. All identifiers must be UUID strings. Review mode scans for PII patterns.

faq.question: What tools can I use with this skill?
faq.answer: Bash, Read, Edit, Write, Glob, Grep, and TodoWrite. These enable code review, validation commands, and tracking implementation progress.

faq.question: How is this different from other analytics skills?
faq.answer: This skill is specifically designed for Django optimo_analytics module with built-in PII protection, 7-step implementation checklist, and review automation.
